alert.note: Alert for Grant; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 26 at 6:13AM MST until January 26 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Roberts and Grant Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reports of low visibility due to blowing snow have filtered in this morning from near Wilmot. The worst conditions look likely along and just east of the Sisseton Hills ridge, and adjacent areas. I29 may be impacted from Summit to Peever.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
